conclusion: Analyze the image to identify current positions of shadows and determine changes when light source moves.
The image shows a green surface with four objects: a white cloth, a black ring, a green object, and a black stand with a mirror. Each object casts a shadow labeled A, B, C, and D.
A is the smallest shadow and D is the largest shadow.
Identify current positions of shadows A, B, C, and D on the green surface.
Understand that the light source is currently positioned to cast these shadows.
Visualize the light source moving to the back left above the objects.
Recognize that moving the light source to the back left will change the angle of the light rays hitting the objects.
Determine that the new angle will cause the shadows to move in the direction opposite to the light source movement.
Conclude that the shadows will shift to the right and possibly become more elongated due to the change in light angle.
When the light source moves to the back left above the objects, shadows A, B, C, and D will change positions, shifting to the right and possibly becoming longer and more elongated.
